Services::Histogramming

Services::Histogramming Namespace Reference

Collection of functions to book and write histograms. More...


Write histograms to file

This group of functions requires the output ROOT file to be opened before invocation. None of the functions takes any control on this file or its status.

Parameters:
[in] noEmpties suppresses writing out empty histograms when set to true (optional, default is true)
[in] group reference to non-modifiable string containing the name of the histogram group to be written out.
[in] name reference to non-modifiable string containing the name of the histogram to be written out.
Returns:
Number of histograms written to file.


unsigned int writeHist (bool noEmpties=true)
 Write all histograms.
unsigned int writeHist (const std::string &group, bool noEmpties=true)
 Write all histograms of a given group.
unsigned int writeHist (const std::string &group, const std::string &name, bool noEntries=true)
 Write single histogram with a given name in a given group.

Write histograms to specified file

This group of functions opens the output ROOT file with name and options specfied in the argument list, and closes the file before return.

Parameters:
[in] fileName reference to non-modifiable string containing the file name
[in] fileOPts options for the internally used TFile object constructions (optional argument, default is "RECREATE"):
  • "WRITE" * Opens a new file for write access. * Will fail if file already exists.
  • "READ" * Opens an existing file for read access. * Not applicable in this context - write will fail
  • "RECREATE" * Opens a new file for write access if file not yet existing. * Overwites the content of an existing file with the new histograms to be written.
  • "APPEND" * Opens an existing file and appends the histograms to be written. * If specified file is not yet existing, creates a new one (TBC!) * Histograms with the same name already in the file will not be overwritten, rather a new version is added.
[in] noEmpties suppresses writing out empty histograms when set to true (optional, default is true)
[in] group reference to non-modifiable string containing the name of the histogram group to be written out.
[in] name reference to non-modifiable string containing the name of the histogram to be written out.
Returns:
Number of histograms written to file.


unsigned int write (const std::string &fileName, const std::string &fileOpt="RECREATE", bool noEmpties=true)
 Write all histograms.
unsigned int write (const std::string &fileName, const std::string &group, const std::string &fileOpt="RECREATE", bool noEmpties=true)
 Write all histograms of a given group.
unsigned int write (const std::string &fileName, const std::string &group, const std::string &name, const std::string &fileOpt="RECREATE", bool noEmpties=true)
 Write single histogram with a given name in a given group.

Booking functions

1-dim histogram like `TH1D` and `TProfile`:

Parameters:
[in] name histogram name
[in] title histogram title
[in] nbins number of bins (x axis)
[in] xmin lower boundary (x axis)
[in] xmax upper boundary (x axis)
[in] xtitle x-axis title (optional, default `""`)
[in] ytitle y-axis title (optional, default `""`)
Additional arguments for 2-dimensional histograms like `TH2D` and `TProfile2D`:

Parameters:
[in] mbins number of bins (y axis)
[in] ymin lower boundary (y axis)
[in] ymax upper boundary (y axis)
[in] ztitle z-axis title (optional, default `""`)
Additional arguments for 3-dimensional histograms like `TH3D`

Parameters:
[in] lbins number of bins (z axis)
[in] zmin lower boundary (z axis)
[in] zmax upper boundary (z axis)

Detailed Description

Collection of functions to book and write histograms.

Presently only `ROOT` based.

Function Documentation
